intro: Senecio pentecostus, commonly known as the Pentecostal groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, elongated fruits known as cypsela. Senecio pentecostus is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
